Yes, I am familiar with Glances. Glances is a cross-platform system monitoring tool for Linux, Windows, and Mac. It provides a real-time view of various system metrics, such as CPU usage, memory usage, disk I/O, network activity, and more.

Glances is written in Python and uses the psutil library to gather system information. It can be run in either client-server mode or standalone mode, and provides a web-based interface for viewing system metrics.

Some of the key features of Glances include:

* Real-time monitoring of various system metrics
* Client-server architecture for remote monitoring
* Web-based interface for viewing system metrics
* Ability to set alarms and notifications based on system metrics
* Support for plugins to extend functionality

Glances is a useful tool for system administrators and developers who need to monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues. It provides a comprehensive view of system metrics in a single dashboard, making it easy to identify performance bottlenecks and other issues.
